results.title: A different perspective
results.brief_description: ‘I was given a photo pass to the 1994 Big Day Out. From then on, outside my day job I worked as a freelance photographer’. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’.

results.title: 3 good reasons
results.brief_description: David Hunt is a volunteer for the Heart Foundation. He speaks of his own personal tragedies and how these particular events have motivated him to dedicate his time to the Heart Foundation. Made as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ in association with Vic Health and the Heart Foundation.

results.title: 50 years of cardiology
results.brief_description: Working in cardiology for many years, Graeme Sloman explains the many achievements he and his fellow colleagues have made in preventing heart disease-related fatalities and building a greater public awareness of heart disease. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) and in partnership with VicHealth.

results.title: Birth of a film festival
results.brief_description: Not many people know that the Melbourne International Film Festival was born at Olinda on the Australia Day weekend in January 1952, when a group of die-hard film buffs found that the only way they could see the European and Asian films they craved was to organise their own film festival. This documentary, filmed at the 50th Melbourne International Film Festival opening night, provides a fascinating glimpse of a significant event in Australian film culture through interviews, archival footage and stills.

results.title: Fast film
results.brief_description: This ingenious cut out animation is the chase film to end all chase films. Borrowing images and characters from various Hollywood classics, ‘Fast film’ then distorts and twists our understanding of where these icons of Hollywood folklore belong. Ultimately mutating into a new narrative where the suave Cary Grant and Frankenstein’s monster happily co-exist side by side.

results.title: For my girls
results.brief_description: Gabby uses her Digital Story to tell her daughters about the inspiring life of their father, who died of a heart attack at the age of 31. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) and in partnership with VicHealth.

results.title: Bolgene
results.brief_description: Two young men who have been boyhood friends for years are taking their regular holiday together on a Scandanavian island. However, with approaching adulthood, the sexual tensions in their relationships begin to emerge. This is a serious and beautifully crafted story about adolescence and innocence, and the inevitability of change. By concentrating on the physicality and intimacy of the two male bodies in space, Mosvold creates a haunting, resonating work.

results.title: Frank's cowshed
results.brief_description: When Cohuna Higher Elementary School wanted to raise money for a film projector, local resident Tom Olsson decided to help by filming life in the township and surrounding countryside, and then showing the footage in the local Town Hall. His footage has been lovingly compiled by the Cohuna Historical Society and the resulting film gives us a special glimpse into rural life in 1950s Victoria. The school received their projector, and Olsson’s films were shown annually as a Christmas treat for many years afterward. This segment documents, at the time, the world famous invention of a step up cowshed by local resident Frank Mathers.

results.title: Ararat
results.brief_description: When Noel Matthews watched this old film to see if it could go into the MAP project he realised that it was of enormous personal significance to him. This footage of Ararat township circa 1930 is combined with a voiceover by Noel explaining why watching this film had such a powerful effect. One of earliest submissions to the MAP project.
